family: Of course your parents push your buttons! They installed them#punctuation#
Pretend you are an anthropologist and your family is part of a study you are conducting.
Yeah, I'm sensitve about it, why don't you back off?
Why are people so weird about the holidays? I don't know.
You don't have to agree but you do have to be civil. At least until the food starts flying. Then you just need good aim.
Remember, your mother-in-law may be difficult, but you also get those delicious cheese balls and even better, stuffed dates!
If I seem a little touchy about this stuff it’s because I am. I wish you well, but I cannot stress how much it’s really not my jam.
Family members may have feelings about something, and that’s understandable, but their feelings don’t automatically trump your own.
Nobody has a perfect holiday or perfect family.
Remember to be nice to the people who support you#punctuation# While they may understand your frustrations (and being the nearest target), they deserve your gratitude and courtesy#punctuation#
Everyone has expectations and fears around how the holidays should be. Cut them (and yourself) some slack#punctuation#
holiday_advice: Have you tried calmly explaining why the situation is not ok for you?
You never know what the person across the table is really going through.
Try not to put unreasonable pressure on yourself to be happy, to rejoice, or even to enjoy the holidays.
Try not to overanalyze your interactions with others.
For people that feed on drama, remove the part of the equation where you feed into it, and make it very boring when drama happens. This stuff only has the power to bother you if you buy into it.
Be realistic, and try not to expect the *ideal* holiday.
Listening is key.  But sometimes *not listening* is key.
Don't abandon your healthy habits and self care, eat right, sleep extra, and breathe a lot.
You can't force yourself to be happy just because it's the holiday season.
Mayo clinic tips for coping with stress during the holidays: https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/stress-management/in-depth/stress/art-20047544
invitations: It is an invitation, not a subpoena#punctuation#
'Thank you for thinking of me but I have other plans.' You don’t need to provide excuses. (And your other plans can be lying on the couch with a book or game.) #selfcare
You are *not* ruining their Christmas by refusing to participate, especially if partcipating means ruining your Dec 25.
You can spend holidays with whomever you like, including just yourself, if that’s how you want to roll.
We prefer a quiet holiday, thanks#punctuation#
Don't be alone, if you don't want to be.
If the old holiday traditions aren’t working, if they’re not making you happy and causing holiday stress, it’s time to do something different#punctuation#
thoughts: You are doing a good job#punctuation#
Your looks do not define you#punctuation# #compliments#
Are you sure you want to spend your #energy# on that?
When you said X, I heard Y. Is that what you meant?
Pie is a perfectly #good# breakfast food. 🥧
Wow, is there a problem? You seem really upset that I celebrate different holidays from you.
say_no: take a break from family time
compliments: Please hang in there, you are #good##punctuation#
I #am happy# that #you are here and##punctuation##emoji#
You are still you and I #like# you#punctuation#
Somebody thinks you are #good# and they are not wrong#punctuation#
you are here and: #you are here# and #you are here and#
you are here: you can show you #kindness# in #good# ways
you are still showing us how #good# you are
reassurance: You do you#punctuation# #be_ok.capitalize# if you want to#punctuation#
You can do this. You are #good##punctuation#
You are strong enough. Don't let anyone tell you differently.
wishes_prefix: i know this is #awful# for you,
I hope you don't mind, I just heard, and
I can not imagine what you are going through,
I know you've gotten through #awful# things before,
wishes_post: I hope it gets easier for you
would a #little# #hug# help? I would be happy to give you as many as you’d take#punctuation#
I wish I could make you feel better. #distractions#
how is it going for you?
difficult as this feels, I know you can get through it#punctuation#
sympathy: You've done the best you could with the tools you had. It is ok.
How are you feeling about what happened?
You will feel better one day but for now... #Anything I can do#
Of course I'm curious about what led to this... but I hope you are doing ok, that's the important part.
That sounds like it feels #awful#. #I'm sorry# #I heard you# #Anything I can do#
#I'm sorry# #I heard you# #Anything I can do#
misc: Would it help if I told you everyone feels this way sometimes?
Anger is a way of saying something here is not right.
Do you know about Spoon Theory? It may be useful to explain things: https://butyoudontlooksick.com/articles/written-by-christine/the-spoon-theory/
No, no, don’t apologize for being sad. Take the time you need. I’m happy you feel safe with me.
Take a deep breath. Repeat this to yourself: 'That’s just their way.'
Well, that #sucks#. But it doesn't define you#punctuation#
I'm sorry: I'm sorry you are going through this.
I heard you: I don't know what to say but I heard you.
Sometimes I don’t say anything because I have no idea what to say and I’m afraid of saying something that will make it worse.
I don’t have the focus or energy to be the listening/comforting friend today, but I didn’t want you to think nobody was listening.
I'm sorry but right now I can't talk, could you look at #twitter_handle# for a bit until I'm free?
Anything I can do: It's not boring, I want to hear.
What do you think you'll do about it?
What do you want to do next?
I want you to know I'm here for you.
Is there anything I could say right now that would help you feel better?
As your friend I don’t always know how to help but I don’t want to leave you hanging.
I don't know if I can help but asking doesn't make you a burden. I just don't know what to offer. Please ask.
What can I do to help?
Let it go: Breathe in and breathe out; let the #negative_emotion# #fly# away.
activities: read our books side by side
go to the beach and watch the waves
distractions: I like #likes#, is there anything you like?
Would talking about it help? I can listen#punctuation#
You know, we don't have to talk, would you like to #activities#?
Would anything make you smile? I have #likes# here I am happy to share.
The laughter will will come back.
What are your next steps and... #Anything I can do#?
What are you biggest concerns right now? #Anything I can do#
What are you looking for right now? #Looking for# #Looking for#
What are you looking for right now? #Looking for# #Looking for# #Anything I can do#
If you need space, that's fine with me. But when you are ready, please let me know if you'd like to do something. For examples, we could #activities#.
I totally understand wanting to be alone right now but if you decide a little company would be nice, maybe we can #activities# #time#.
You are being perfectly reasonable, of course, but... how about a snack before we continue the conversation? #emoji_snacks#
Looking for: Someone to see that #you are here#? (I do.)
likes: the way the sky looks after it rains
reminders: One #little# action is worth a thousand nice thoughts.
Many small acts of kindness is usually more helpful than one grand gesture.
You are allowed to be nice and then wander off, it isn't a life sentence.
Listening is key.
You don't have to fix it.
Their situation is different from what you know, be patient and kind.
Understanding comes later; for now, listen.
Give confidence. And smile occasionally.
It doesn't require an expert to make someone happy.
Do what you are good at, help in your own way.
Put your own oxygen mask on first.
Yes, sending an email is sufficient.
Yes, sending a card would be lovely. And enough.
It is ok to set limits.
Sometimes it is their whole life but they may still want to talk to someone about anything else. Distractions are good.

You mustn’t feel guilty that you didn’t know
 especialy if you weren’t told.
Sometimes people aren’t ready to share their burdens.
That can be a good decision for them. 
And it isn't about you.
It is ok to set boundaries.

Don’t pressure the person to come up with or have answers to plan-making questions, especially immediate answers, just change the habit from eternal doom to eternal doom + maybe naming one tiny action.
Sometimes don’t give advice. Don’t offer solutions. Don’t feed the spiral. Just sit there with the person for a second and say *I see you.*

It is ok to say something like 
 *I’m so sorry, that must feel #awful#. I really think it’s time to call in the cavalry and get some professional help.*
Thank you to Kelsey Crowe and Emily McDowell. Their book _There Is No Good Card For This_ is a great resource on how to be a good friend.
Captain Awkward (https://captainawkward.com/) is an amazing resource for what to say and how to say it.
#kindness.capitalize# is built in layers, like #layeredthings#.
Sometimes I have to remember: #boundaries.capitalize#
Do you know about the Ring Theory of kvetching? It is useful: http://articles.latimes.com/2013/apr/07/opinion/la-oe-0407-silk-ring-theory-20130407
This is sad but a good reminder of what some people may be going through: https://butyoudontlooksick.com/articles/written-by-christine/the-spoon-theory/ #SpoonTheory
I need what I need – I’m not doing it to make you sad, but if you are a little sad, I can live with that. I’ll have to take care of myself.
boundaries: it is not my job to fix others.
it is okay if others get angry.
it is okay to say no.
it is not my job to take responsibility for others.
I don’t have to anticipate the needs of others.
it is my job to make me happy.
nobody has to agree with me.
I have a right to my own feelings.
it is ok not to be ok.
it is ok not to be normal.
toughlove: You've been #complaining# about this, #what are you going to do#
I feel like I've been supportive of you on this topic but I wonder if you need more of a push: #what are you going to do
Maybe you need to set boundaries. Say it with me: #boundaries#
Do you want to keep #complaining# or start doing?
A++ in denial and compartmentalization. But you know it is going to leak out into your life in sneaky ways, right?
I know this is a huge part of your life and I want to be there for you but I miss talking with you about other things.
That sounds serious, maybe you should keep a diary or journal to track it?
what are you going to do: what are you going to do to fix it?
what can I do to help you get on with fixing it?
what steps do you need to take to get to better place?
what are your next steps and... #Anything I can do#?
what do you think you'll do about it?
what do you want to do next?
